result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Earl Ely

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy Earl Ely in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Tommy Earl Ely.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  Attorney Krejci is now the attorney of record.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 12-5-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 12-14-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Earl Ely in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Tommy Earl Ely.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense withdraws bail motion.  Attorney Krejci was just appointed to the case. Defense in need of discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 10-21-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered no contact with TMH
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tommy Earl Ely appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Tommy Earl Ely.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
